div.l: Swilk as he fynt or take swilk as he brynges
But specyally I pray þe oost dere
Get vs som mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make vs cheere
And we wol payen trewly atte fulle
Wit empti handes may noon haukes tulle
Lo here oure seluer redy for to spende
This Meller͗e to þe town his doughter sende
For ale ⁊and breed and rosted hem a goos
And bonde hir hors it shold no more go loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bedde
With shetes ⁊and with chalons faire y spredde
Nouȝt from his owne bed ten fote or twelue
His doughter hadde a bed al by hir selue
Right in þe same chambr͗e by and by
It myght be no bette and cause why
Ther was no romer herborowe in the place
They soupen ⁊and þey speken hem to solace
And drynken euer strong ale atte beste
A bowte mydde nyght wente þey to reste
Wel haþ þis meller vernesshed his hedde
Full pale he was for dronkyn ⁊and nouȝt red
He yexeþ and he spekeþ þorugh oute þe nose
As he ware on þe quakke or on pose
To bed he goth ant wiþ hym goth his wife
As any Iay he ligth was as Iolyf
So was hire Ioly whistel wel y wette
The cradell at hir beddes fete is y sette
To rokken and to yeue þe child to souke
And whan þat dronken was al in þe crouke
To bedde wente þe doughter right a non
To bedde goth Aleyn and also Iohn
There nas no more þem nedede no dwale
